definition: Takeshima (Korean Dokdo 獨島|独岛[Du2 dao3]), disputed islands in Sea of Japan

sentences.english: And actually Takeshima was taken from Japan during the Korean War.
sentences.chinese: 實際，竹島是在朝鮮戰爭中從日本被奪走的。

sentences.english: South Korea’s government has asked that Japan’s refrain from referring to the Takeshima question.
sentences.chinese: 南韓政府已要求日本政府提及竹島問題時，保持克制。

sentences.english: Takeshima by the ROK current actual control.
sentences.chinese: 竹島當前由韓國實際控制。

sentences.english: Japan insists Dokdo should be called “Takeshima”.
sentences.chinese: 日本堅稱獨島應該叫“竹島”。

sentences.english: More probably the delay has something to do with the Takeshima islands.
sentences.chinese: 推遲更有可能是和竹島有關。

definition: to make a sound effect/sound effect/(historical linguistics) to reconstruct the sound system of an archaic language
to write a word incorrectly/typo/(medicine) to mistakenly transplant (an infected organ etc)
to communicate by means of written notes (instead of speaking)/to publish one's opinion (e.g. as part of a scholarly dialogue)/(in book titles) essays/sketches
